page.title: 05PIG FARMING
page.content: When piglets are born they are about fifteen cms long and about ten cms high. They are born in farrowing crates. The sows have about fifteen piglets at a time. After about two and a half weeks they stop drinking from their mother. At two and a half weeks they go on to cuckoo pellets. At about three weeks they are weaned to a bigger pen. Piglets sometimes get scowers. That is when white liquid comes out of them. You have to throw some turf into the pen. At about six weeks the piglets have to be split up. When they are about six weeks old they are porkers. At seven weeks old they are sent off to be killed. The owners then sell the meat in the winter.
